name: candlewick
content:
candlewick noun
(MATERIAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] thick, soft material with raised areas of short threads on the surface: There was a pink candlewick bedspread on the bed. Her old candlewick dressing-gown had finally fallen to pieces.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bedspread is pink and peach candlewick.She came down the stairs wearing a light blue candlewick dressing gown.Since the early 20th century, Dalton has been a centre for the candlewick industry.

candlewick noun
(PART OF CANDLE)
[ U or C ] (also candle wick) a piece of string in the centre of a candle that burns to produce light and heat: There was the smell of scented candlewick. Sarah picked up and struck a match and put the flame to the candle wick.
More examplesFewer examplesSarah picked up and struck a match and put the flame to the candle wick. You can make your own candlewick out of thick cotton cord.The candlewicks were trimmed to cast a dim glow around the room.
